title: Manchester City ace Gabriel Jesus on the mend after successful metatarsal operation
text:
JESUS HEALING Manchester City ace Gabriel Jesus on the mend after successful metatarsal operation 
The Brazilian striker went under the knife in Barcelona on Thursday and is already on the road to recovery By James Roberts Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MANCHESTER CITY star Gabriel Jesus is on the road to recovery after a successful operation at the hands of Pep Guardiola’s favoured physician, Dr Ramon Cugat. 
The teenager flew out to Barcelona for Thursday’s procedure, which passed without any problems. A post shared by Gabriel Jesus (@dejesusoficial) on Feb 19, 2017 at 10:22am PST Gabriel Jesus was in good spirits after the operation on his metatarsal 
Jesus reassured worried City fans with an upbeat Instagram post on Sunday night. 
The striker wrote ‘Agora e so recuperar’, which translates as ‘now just recover’, alongside a picture of him leaving hospital wearing crutches and a protective boot. 
His recovery is expected to take between eight and twelve weeks, some of which will be spent in his native Brazil. Getty Images Jesus broke his metatarsal during Manchester City’s 2-0 victory at Bournemouth Manchester City star Gabriel Jesus is injured in the first half at Bournemouth Reuters Jesus scored in both of his first two league starts for City 
On Friday Pep Guardiola cast doubts over whether the Brazilian will play again this season. "He'll be back when he's fit. I don't know if that's the end of the season or next season. "It's important to have good recovery. Now we'll give all our support to him and his family and waiting for him to be back." Manchester City 2 Swansea 1: Gabriel Jesus nets last-gasp winner Related stories no miracle cure Neymar visits crocked Gabriel Jesus in hospital as Pep Guardiola admits the striker's season could be over after undergoing surgery JESUS UNDER KNIFE Gabriel Jesus has surgery in Barcelona to repair fractured metatarsal and faces eight weeks out WRIGHTY'S PODCAST 'Your feet have hardly any protection', Gabriel Jesus' injury was due to flimsy boots, claims Ian Wright BREAKING NEWS Manchester City confirm new £29million star Gabriel Jesus has suffered a broken metatarsal and will miss 'two to three months' STERLING JOB Bournemouth 0 Man City 2: Raheem Sterling and Sergio Aguero fire Pep Guardiola's side to eight points off Chelsea 
Until the injury Jesus had enjoyed a dream start to life in Manchester. 
He made an instant impact during an eight-minute cameo against Tottenham, with a winning goal ruled out for offside. 
The 19 year old then scored twice in four days, finding the net at West Ham on his full debut and scoring a late winner to beat Swansea at the Etihad Stadium.
